ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ الٓر تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Alif Lam Ra Those are the Signs of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the authoritative Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are the verses of the Book overflowing with wisdom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are the verses of the Book of wisdom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Alif-Lam-Ra*; these are verses of the Book of wisdom. (*alphabets of the Arabic language; Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Alif-Lam-Ra. These are the verses of the Book (the Qur'an) Al-Hakim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Alif Lam Ra. Those are the signs of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verses of the Wise Scripture.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book of Wisdom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Alif-Lam-Ra. These are the verses of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the signs of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A. L. R. These are the ayats of the Book of Wisdom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Alif-Lam-Ra. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. These are the Verses of the Book (the Quran) Al-Hakim [showing lawful and unlawful things, explaining Allah's (Divine) Laws for mankind, leading them to eternal happiness by ordering them to follow the true Islamic Monotheism, - worshipping none but Allah Alone - that will guide them to Paradise and save them from Hell].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: AlifLaamRa. Those are the verses of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the Verses of the Wise Book.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the wise Book
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [10:1] Alif lām rā’: God knows best what He means by these [letters]. Those, namely, these signs, are the signs of the wise Book, that is, the Qur’ān (the genitive annexation [āyāt al-kitāb] has the meaning of min [sc. min āyāti’l-kitāb, ‘from among the verses of the Book’]), which has been made clear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning Allah's saying (Alif. Lam. Ra): '(Alif. Lam. Ra.) Allah says: I am Allah: I see; it is also said that it is an oath by which Allah swore. (These are verses of the wise Scripture) this surah consists of the verses of the clear Qur'an, expositing the lawful and the prohibited.
